BodyCopy: The 6-month combined ratio for a group of 18 U.S. property-casualty reinsurers was 92.3 percent, according to a survey of the Reinsurance Association of America (RAA). The combined ratio was composed of a 73.7 percent loss ratio and an expense ratio of 18.6 percent. The total surplus of this group of reinsurers increased by $4.2 billion in the second quarter to a total of $142.9 billion. See a breakdown of the second quarter 2014 underwriting results by reinsurer. Printable versions of the RAA reports are available at the website. If your captive is reinsured by one or more of these reinsurers, the results may be useful for the purpose of your financial due diligence.
